SEARCH
Module com.teamsix.databasegui
Package com.teamsix.databasegui

Class DatabaseSetup

java.lang.Object
com.teamsix.databasegui.DatabaseSetup
public class DatabaseSetup extends Object
DatabaseSetup class handles interactions with the database. It provides methods for setting up the connection, performing various database operations, and fetching data from the database.

    • DatabaseSetup

      public DatabaseSetup()
      Constructor for DatabaseSetup class. Initializes the database connection.

  • Method Details

    • closeConnection

      public void closeConnection()
      Closes the database connection.

    • DeleteSeasonalItem

      public void DeleteSeasonalItem(String end_date)
      Deletes a seasonal item from the database based on its end date.
      Parameters:
      end_date - The end date of the seasonal item to be deleted.

    • addOrderHistory

      public void addOrderHistory(int order, String itemList, boolean togo, double totalPrice, String time, int employeeId, boolean isCustomized)
      Appends a new order to the order history table.
      Parameters:
      order - ID of the order.
      itemList - Menu item IDs of all items being checked out.
      togo - True if the order is togo, false if not togo.
      totalPrice - The total price of all items in the cart, including taxes.
      time - The time of the order when it was placed.
      employeeId - The ID of the employee who completed the order.
      isCustomized - True if the item is customized, False if not.

    • getEmployeeIdByName

      public int getEmployeeIdByName(String name)
      Retrieves the employee ID by the employee name from the database.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the employee.
      Returns:
      The employee ID if found, otherwise -1.

    • getEmployeeTitle

      public String getEmployeeTitle(String name)
      Retrieves the employee title by the employee name from the database.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the employee.
      Returns:
      The title of the employee if found, otherwise null.

    • getCategoryItems

      public Map<String,Double> getCategoryItems(String category)
      Retrieves the menu items and their prices by category from the database.
      Parameters:
      category - The category of the menu items.
      Returns:
      A map containing the menu item names as keys and their prices as values.

    • addSeasonalMenuItem

      public void addSeasonalMenuItem(int newSID, String category, String name, String ingredient1, String ingredient2, String ingredient3, String ingredient4, String ingredient5, String ingredient6, String ingredient7, String price, boolean customization, String startDate, String endDate)
      Add a seasonal item to the menu. The item will only be available duing the selected start and end dates.
      Parameters:
      newSID - Seasonal menu ID
      category - Type of food. Example: burger
      name - Name of the menu item
      ingredient1 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient2 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient3 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient4 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient5 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient6 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient7 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      price - Price of the menu item
      customization - Is the item customized
      startDate - When will this item debut?
      endDate - When will this item leave the menu?

    • addMenuItem

      public void addMenuItem(int newID, String category, String name, int itemID, String ingredient1, String ingredient2, String ingredient3, String ingredient4, String ingredient5, String ingredient6, String ingredient7, String price, boolean customization)
      Add a new item to the menu. This will automatically update the item to populate in the menu view.
      Parameters:
      newID - The table id of the menu item.
      category - Type of food. Example: burger.
      name - The name of the new menu item.
      itemID - The item id of the menu item.
      ingredient1 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient2 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient3 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient4 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient5 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient6 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      ingredient7 - ingredient used in this menu item. Can be null.
      price - Price of the menu item
      customization - Is the item customized

    • updateItemPrice

      public void updateItemPrice(int itemId, double newPrice)
      Updates the price of a menu item in the database.
      Parameters:
      itemId - The ID of the menu item.
      newPrice - The new price of the menu item.

      Returns:

      Returns:

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the ingredient.
      numAdded - The quantity to be added to the stock.

      Decreases the stock quantity of an ingredient in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the ingredient.
      numUsed - The quantity to be deducted from the stock.

    • sellTogether

      public List<Object[]> sellTogether(String startDate, String endDate)
      Retrieves data about items that are frequently sold together within a given date range.
      Parameters:
      startDate - The start date of the date range.
      endDate - The end date of the date range.
      Returns:
      A list containing arrays of menu item pairs and their frequencies.

    • getProductUsage

      public ResultSet getProductUsage(LocalDate startDate, LocalDate endDate)
      Retrieves the product usage information from the database within a given date range.
      Parameters:
      startDate - The start date of the date range.
      endDate - The end date of the date range.
      Returns:
      The result set containing product usage information.

    • getSalesReport

      public List<SalesReport> getSalesReport(String startDate, String endDate) throws SQLException
      Retrieves the sales report data from the database within a given date range.
      Parameters:
      startDate - The start date of the date range.
      endDate - The end date of the date range.
      Returns:
      The list of sales report objects containing menu item names, quantities sold, and revenues.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an SQL error occurs.

    • getIngredientByID

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the ingredient.
      Returns:
      The name of the ingredient.

    • getCategories

      public ArrayList<String> getCategories()
      Retrieves the list of distinct categories of menu items from the database.
      Returns:
      The list of distinct categories.
